reviews.review_msg: Super shocked by his low ratings on here tbh This man is an absolute gem. He teaches a super laid back class with tons of interesting content. A great example of a prof who is passionate about his topics of choice and also about teaching them. He sets you up for success and goes over practical stuff (how to cite, how to use the archives etc) 10/10

Liam is super caring and gives really good, thorough feedback. I've taken two classes with him and initially it can seem like he's a tough grader but he just pays close attention to the specific details in your papers, which for an upper division history course should not be surprising. Most of the assignments are based on readings. He's great tbh
